feed.title: NetAlertX Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v24.7.18 - TP-Link Omada SupportğŸ§ª, NetBIOS scan, MQTTğŸ“¡, UI Enhancements ğŸš€
entry.content:
Hey everyone ğŸ‘‹

FlyingToto created an amazing new experimental TP-Link Omada plugin ğŸ§ª, enabling auto-network topology creation ğŸŒ. Additional highlights include a granular NEWDEV_NAME_CLEANUP_REGEX setting ğŸ”, cache expiration improvements â²ï¸, and the ability to specify devices sent to MQTT ğŸ“¡.

UI updates improve device status visibility ğŸŸ¢ğŸ”´, add some customization to tiles ğŸ§©, and sortable columns ğŸ“Š in the Network view.

Core updates add new fields for network tree generation ğŸŒ³, plugin transformers ğŸ”§, and settings page refactoring ğŸ› ï¸. Refresh your browser cache ğŸ”„ after upgrade.

If you are developer, check out the new 15-minute plugin development video ğŸ¥

ğŸ¥Watch the video

Make sure you refresh your browser cache (usually shift + reload button) - and click the ğŸ”„ refresh button in the top right corner.

Screenshots

| | | |----------------------|----------------------| | | | | | |

ğŸ’” Breaking changes

Sometimes I have to introduce breaking changes

  • Removed NEWDEV_LESS_NAME_CLEANUP and replaced with a more granular NEWDEV_NAME_CLEANUP_REGEX setting

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • Video on how to ğŸ¥develop a plugin in 15min (ğŸ†•)

âš™Settings

  • Cache expiration improvements #698 (âœ¨)
  • A new NEWDEV_NAME_CLEANUP_REGEX setting so you can specify how newly discovered device names are handled #725 (ğŸ†•)
  • A MQTT_DEVICES_SQL setting if you want to specify which devices are sent to MQTT #732 (ğŸ†•)

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • (ExperimentalğŸ§ª) OMADA TP-Link import support including auto-network topology creation by @FlyingToto #708 (ğŸ†•)
  • The MQTT / Home Assitant integration provides a device_tracker sensor with attributes #703 (ğŸ†•)
  • Some default Plugins couldn't be unloaded #726 (âœ¨)
  • Better pfSense / SNMP support with better docs #718 (âœ¨)

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • The device status now shows colors and icons, so even visually impaired users can easily distinguish statuses #706 (ğŸ†•)
  • You can now select which tiles in the Devices section are shown (+ All, Offline tiles added) #705 (ğŸ†•)
  • Sortable columns in the Network page #713 (ğŸ†•)
  • Improved Search filtering (âœ¨)
  • Improved Maintenance -> Logs section (ğŸ†•)
  • Paste to import CSV in Maintenance (ğŸ†•)

ğŸ’ Core app updates

Internal changes affecting the whole app and usually significant to developers ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»

  • New Fields in the CurrentScan table to support the Network tree generation from plugins (ğŸ†•)
  • Plugin transformers, such as base64 encoding, can be applied to arrays (ğŸ†•)
  • Settings page refactoring (âœ¨)
  • Ability to specify the execution order of plugins with the "execution_order" : "Layer_0" property in config.json (ğŸ†•)

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • adding wonderfully written omada sdn probe by @FlyingToto in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/737

New Contributors

  • @FlyingToto made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/737

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v24.6.8...v24.7.18

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v24.9.12 - ğŸ“£Native Telegram, Mikrotik support, Discord server, Settings set via ENV variables ğŸ§ª
entry.content:
This release is packed with amazing features, improvements, and contributions from our fantastic community. A special shoutout to everyone who helped test, refine, and push the boundaries of what weâ€™re building together. Your feedback and dedication make every release better, and I couldnâ€™t do it without you. I hope you enjoy these updates! ğŸ‰

ğŸ˜ï¸ Community

  • A special thanks to @corasaniti to help me deliver you a less buggy release by testing the dev branch ğŸ™âœ¨
  • A new discord server ğŸ†•

âš™Settings

  • Cleanup of list item manipulation buttons to improve the UI âœ¨
  • Experimental docker-compose override support with ENV variables #687 ğŸ§ªğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • A native Telegram publisher by @doctorixx ğŸ™ ğŸ†•
  • The UNIFI plugin now auto-generates the network topology map and passes the device type ğŸ†•
  • A new MIKROTIK MTSCAN plugin by amazing @lookflying and @elraroğŸ™ ğŸ†•
  • Improvements to the OMADA SDN plugin by @FlyingToto âœ¨
  • SSL support for the MQTT plugin by @adebrouvier âœ¨
  • Fix for MQTT device tracker adding quotes to payload and Protocol selection, which can be v3 or v5 by @ingoratsdorf ğŸ™ âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • Polish, French, Russian, German, Spanish, Italian, Chinese, and Norwegian translation improvements by the community (@ozeliurs, @a74451, @GoldBull3t, @blomusti, @mapi68, @gallegonovato, @YoSafeguard, @ternium1, @GitSpoon, @serega404, @ptsa, @Atalanttore, @Ramonnote )ğŸ™âœ¨
  • Cache expiration and first-load improvements âœ¨
  • Notification about the app being updated to prompt browser cache refresh based on the VERSION setting ğŸ†•
  • Moved the remaining settings from Maintenance (e.g. displayed columns) into Settings -> Core -> UI Settings âœ¨

ğŸ’ Core app updates

Internal changes affecting the whole app and usually significant to developers ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»

  • Bare metal installation fixes #753 âœ¨
  • Some icons and device types are auto-assigned vendor information when a device is discovered ğŸ†•
  • 4 More Helper Values that can be used to pass data from plugins to the Core app ğŸ†•
  • The HRS_TO_KEEP_NEWDEV setting wasn't applied correctly causing new devices to be always deleted #777 âœ¨

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

Screenshots

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v24.9.26 - Auto-Clearing of the ğŸ†• NEW Device flag, Settings and Sync hub improvements
entry.content:
This release introduces a handy new feature with the CLEAR_NEW_FLAG setting, which automatically unflags devices as "NEW" after a set amount of time following detection. This should streamline device management by reducing the manual effort needed to track device statuses. Alongside this, there are various plugin and UI improvements, ensuring smoother operation and an overall better user experience. As always, make sure to refresh your browser cache, and a big thanks to the contributors for their hard work, be it by contributing in discussions, with code, or translations!

Screenshots

ğŸ˜ï¸ Community

  • An interesting discussion between @FlyingToto and @rludo2 on how to handle different WANs
  • Thanks to the translation contributions of @gallegonovato âœ¨
  • Thank you to people that reported bugs and helped test the netalertx-dev image: @thefunkygibbon, @Dan-Sun, @franbri, @The1Waterman, @itsmemac, @BambamNZ, @richtj999 ğŸ™

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • Better SYNC plugin docs describing the 3 available modes. âœ¨
  • Updates to the Plugins development guide âœ¨

âš™Settings

  • A new CLEAR_NEW_FLAG setting to auto-un-flag the devices as NEW after a predetermined time after detection #795 ğŸ†•
  • Display of an overlay for Settings overridden via a docker-compose variable so that users are not confused where the values are coming from ğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • SYNC plugin improvements allowing you to PULL data from nodes #788 âœ¨
  • The SETPWD plugin wasn't saving the password in the correct format #793 âœ¨
  • UNDIS plugin wasn't generating a fake MAC address preventing these devices to be used in the Network tree map #807 âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • Icon preview for the NEWDEV_dev_Icon setting #789 ğŸ†•
  • Cleanup of some invalid icon values that displayed incorrectly in the Icons dropdown #802 âœ¨
  • Misc UI fixes by @ingoratsdorf âœ¨

ğŸ’ Core app updates

Internal changes affecting the whole app and usually significant to developers ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»

  • Better support for reverse proxies by @alnviana ğŸ†•
  • New Settings capabilities to define onChange events and customParams HTML attributes ğŸ†•
  • New span Setting UI component ğŸ†•
  • Sanitizing input values to prevent errors on single-quotes ' in device text fields #805 âœ¨

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • Fixes to CSS and scripts not loading properly by @ingoratsdorf in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/798
  • Fixes to work using a reverse proxy by @alnviana in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/801

New Contributors

  • @alnviana made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/801

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v24.9.12...v24.9.26

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v24.10.12 - Better name discovery, MQTT and UI improvements âœ¨
entry.content:
Hey everyone ğŸ‘‹

This release contains stability improvements, bug fixes and a couple of new features. There is a new plugin for better device name resolution (AVAHISCAN) that helps getting more accurate device names especially for Apple devices. Thanks @stanelie for testing and the patience ğŸ™‚

Contributors helped me make the MQTT plugin better to support EMQX and to display time values in the Home Assistant attributes better. Thanks to @ingoratsdorf , @NightMean , @Jozko568 ğŸ™

There are a couple of UI improvements in the Settings section on mobile, easier selection of Plugins, separately showing offline and down devices in the presence chart.

I've updated a few docs and also written up how to improve the performance on how to keep the app chugging along without issues ğŸš‚

As always, thanks to everyone helping with translations (@ytorres, @Noschvie, @mapi68, @YoSafeguard, @gallegonovato), answering discussions (@leiweibau, @FlyingToto), testing (@corasaniti) and contributing (@RincewindX) in any way! ğŸ’ª

Make sure you refresh your browser cache (usually shift + reload button) - and click the ğŸ”„ refresh button in the top right corner.

| | | |--------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------| | | |

ğŸ˜ï¸ Community

  • Big thanks to @corasaniti for testing the dev branch ğŸ™

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • How to improve the performance ğŸ†•
  • Improvement to the developer environment setup docs âœ¨
  • Improving the clarity of the Subnets docs âœ¨

âš™Settings

  • MQTT_topic_root allowing to specify a custom topic, e.g. netalertx instead of the default system-sensors âœ¨
  • NEWDEV_ignored_IPs and NEWDEV_ignored_MACs where not applied on new device discovery #836

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • AVAHISCAN for mDNS device name lookup to retrieve better names especially for Apple devices #815 ğŸ†•
  • MQTT improvements to support EMQX by @ingoratsdorf âœ¨
  • MQTT improvements by @NightMean and @Jozko568, such as better diacritics support âœ¨
  • UNIFIMP didn't handle new devices correctly if a port value was passed to the app #833 âœ¨
  • UNIFIMP is now normalizing strings so that diacritics are normalized and not skipped camÃ©ra -> camera âœ¨
  • MIKROTIK didn't pass IPs correctly, so they were missing in the devices tables #835 âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • CSV export didn't handle quotes and new lines in the comments field #808 âœ¨
  • Presence over time chart shows Down devices separately from Offline devices #816 ğŸ†•
  • Settings Mobile UI improvements to show description in pop-up and full-width input area âœ¨
  • Gradual replacement of the click+select setting component with a drop-down and pill component ğŸ†•
  • Removal of DB backup functionality (usually handled externally) in the Maintenance section for easier code maintenance âœ¨

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

Previous releases:

https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/releases

Target release frequency:

  • Monthly

What's Changed

  • fixes to MQTT publisher by @ingoratsdorf in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/810
  • Update MQTT to send model as device name by @NightMean in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/820
  • Update DEBUG_TIPS.md by @RincewindX in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/827

New Contributors

  • @NightMean made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/820
  • @RincewindX made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/827

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v24.9.26...v24.10.12

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v24.10.31 - ğŸ”Œ Better Plugins UI and Auto deletion of Offline devices
entry.content:
In this release @johnwang16 helped solve a couple of issues, for example he fixed an issue where the presence would be empty for always-on devices ğŸ™ Another contributor, @richtj999 helped write up a use case for the Sync Hub. Thanks guys and everyone else that contributed, like the always speedy translation team @mapi68 , @realgooseman , @GitSpoon , @YoSafeguard , @wial88 , @ytorres ... Also @Stationary-1 helped me to debug a couple of issues, including 2 related to the INTRNSPD plugin, so it's more robust in reporting your internet speeds.

Other improvements include adding a Source Plugin column, so that you see which plugin detected the device, a rebuild of the Plugins view with data tables so you can filter, sort and some other quality of life improvements, such disabling Alert Events on a Device won't prevent New Device notifications or a new setting HRS_TO_KEEP_OFFDEV to delete offline devices after a certain time. Check out more details below.

Thanks everyone for the help!

Screenshots

| | | |--------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------| | | |

ğŸ’” Breaking changes

Sometimes I have to introduce breaking changes

  • If you used "UI_dark_mode":"True" in your docker-compose.yml you need to replace it with "UI_theme":"Dark" and you might need to rebuild your container.

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • Notes On WiFi Extenders #852
  • Sync Hub Use case by @richtj999 ğŸ™#788

âš™Settings

  • A new setting HRS_TO_KEEP_OFFDEV to delete offline devices after a certain time #865 ğŸ†•
  • Sync: Generate token/key buttons as they are also used for Homepage authentication #838 ğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • The INTRNSPD plugin didn't display values over 100 and was frequently failing #854 âœ¨
  • The ROGUEDHCP plugin didn't allow for custom timeout configuration #851 âœ¨
  • The UNFINMP plugin may have imported devices with incorrect MAC addresses causing restarts #848 âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • Auto dark theme selection ( UI_dark_mode -> UI_theme) depending on system settings by @johnwang16 ğŸ™ğŸ†•
  • Rebuild the Plugins section with data tables allowing for filtering, sorting ğŸ†•
  • Preventing infinite recursion on the Network diagram #857 âœ¨
  • Clickable IPs in the devices listing table #856 ğŸ†•
  • Colors explanation in the presence page ğŸ†•
  • Custom values didn't show up in the Location dropdown #862 âœ¨
  • @cvc90 fixed an issue causing problems with reverse proxies on the Notifications page âœ¨

ğŸ’ Core app updates

Internal changes affecting the whole app and usually significant to developers ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»

  • Empty presence of always on devices fixed by @johnwang16 ğŸ™#814
  • A new Source Plugin column on the Devices tables so you can quickly see where the device was discovered ğŸ†•
  • Disabling Alert Events on a Device won't prevent New Device notifications #262 âœ¨

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • Changed the "absolute URL" target to "relative URL" in userNotifications.php for viewing reports by @cvc90 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/837
  • Fix network tree offline color for SVG icons by @johnwang16 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/850
  • Allow auto light/dark mode matching user OS setting by @johnwang16 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/853
  • Add events for imported devs by @johnwang16 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/855

New Contributors

  • @johnwang16 made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/850

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v24.10.12...v24.10.31
